stingray/persistence/cookiename.description:
The name of the cookie that should be tracked,
   when using application cookie-based persistence.

stingray/vserver/response_rules.description: A space-separated list of response rules that should be applied to this virtual server.

stingray/vserver/name.description: The name of this virtual server

stingray/trafficipgroups/slaves.description: The passive machines for this Traffic IP Group

stingray/pool/algorithm.description: The loadbalancing algorithm to use for the pool.

stingray/pool/nodes.description: A space-separate list of nodes in the form "host:port"

stingray/vserver/port.description: The port that the virtual server listens on

stingray/accept_license.description:
Whether or not you agree to the terms of Riverbed's
	EULA as described at http://www.riverbed.com/license.  This needs to
	be set to "accept" if you agreed to the terms.

stingray/monitors/use_ssl.description: Whether or not the monitor should wrap the poll in SSL.

stingray/monitors/editable_keys.description: A list of input keys that are editable via the GUI.

stingray/vserver/pool.description: The name of the group of application servers.

stingray/trafficipgroups/keeptogether.description: Whether or not each address in this group should always be hosted by the same traffic manager.

stingray/trafficipgroup/enabled.description: Whether or not this Traffic IP Address Group is enabled.

stingray/monitors/timeout.description:
The amount of time before a health monitor times out, once
    it has attempted to open a connection with a node.

stingray/monitors/name.description: The name of the health monitor.

stingray/pool/disabled.description: A space-separated list of nodes that should be disabled.

stingray/monitors/scope.description:
When set to pernode, each node is monitored separately.
    When set to perpool, a failure detected on a single node will cause the
    entire pool to be treated as failed.

stingray/monitors/can_use_ssl.description:
Whether or not the protocol that monitor is testing can be
    SSL-wrapped.

stingray/pool/monitors.description: A space-sepated list of monitor classes to use for this pool.

stingray/pool/draining.description: A space-separated list of nodes that should be draining.

stingray/vserver/ssl_certificate.description: The configuration-name of the SSL Certificate to use to decrypt traffic.

stingray/path.description: The path where Stingray is or will be located.

stingray/monitors/delay.description: The delay time between monitor polls.

stingray/vserver/ssl_decrypt.description: Whether or not the virtual server should decrypt traffic.

stingray/vserver/address.description: The IP address(es) and/or Traffic IP Groups that this virtual server shoud listen on.

stingray/ec2.description: Whether or not the instance is being launched in EC2.

stingray/name.description: The name of the chef resource to use.

stingray/pool/weightings.description: For the weighted load-balancing algorithms, the weight to apply to each node.

stingray/vserver/protocol.description: The protocol used deliver the application.  Note: For SSL-offload, this must be set to "http".

stingray/trafficipgroup/ipaddresses.description: A space-separated list of IP addresses that belong to this group.

stingray/monitors/type.description:
The type of monitor; may be any of [ program, connect,
    tcp_transaction, ping, sip ]

stingray/monitors/failures.description:
The number of consecultive failures required to trigger a
    node failure event.

stingray/persistence/name.description: The name of a session persistence class.

stingray/pool/priority.description: A space separated list of nodes, and priority groups in the form: "host:port:priority".  Priority being an integer.

stingray/vserver/rules.description: A space-separated list of rules that should be applied to this virtual server.

stingray/vserver/private_key.description: The configuration-name of the private key to use to decrypt traffic.

stingray/trafficipgroups/machines.description: Which traffic managers should be allows to host this Traffic IP Group

stingray/trafficipgroup/name.description: The name of a Traffic IP Address Group

stingray/tmpdir.description: The name of the directory used to store temporary files.

stingray/persistence/type.description: The method used for session persistence.

stingray/pool/maxconns.description: The maximum number of connections that the traffic manager should make to each application server.

stingray/java_enabled.description: Whether or not Java Extensions should be enabled. Java requires separate licensing, so it is disabled by default.

stingray/monitors/factory.description:
Whether or not this monitor is one provided out-of-the-box by
    Riverbed.

stingray/pool/persistence.description: The name of a session-persistence class to use.

stingray/vserver/enabled.description: Whether or not this virtual server should listen.

stingray/license_key.description: The name of the license key file that will be used for the installation.

stingray/admin_pass.description: The password to set for the admin user.

long_description:
#Description
This cookbook contains an LWRP for installing and configuring Stingray Traffic
Manager using node attributes.  Currently, the only provider writes files
directly.  In future, someone may write another provider that uses the API,
CLI, or **zconf**.

#Copyright

Copyright (C) 2012, Riverbed Technology, Inc. All rights reserved.

#Requirements

 * Chef
 * Stingray Traffic Manager


#Resources

##stingray

#Providers

##default
Developed against version 9.0; should probably be made a symbolic link to the
latest version.

##stingray90

*TODO*

##stingray90r2

*TODO*

#Libraries

Libraries in this cookbook are used to read existing configuration state from files.
There is no simple or reliable key/value system used in STM's config files, so it's
not straight-forward to simply split each line into a hash (unfortunately).

*Note:* None of these should be considered comprehensive in the fields that they read.

##GlobalCfg.rb

For reading parameters from the global.cfg file.  

##Persistence.rb

For reading parameters from session persistence class files.

##Pools.rb

For reading parameters from pool configuration files.

##TrafficIPGroups.rb

For reading parameters from Traffic IP Groups.

##VirtualServer.rb

For reading parameters from virtual servers.

#Recipes

##application_create.rb

##cluster_join.rb

##cluster_new.rb

##default.rb

##install.rb

##persistence.rb

##pool.rb

##purge.rb

##reset_to_default.rb

##trafficipgroup.rb

##uninstall.rb

##virtual_server.rb

##virtual_server_delete.rb

##virtual_server_start.rb

##virtual_server_stop.rb

#Attributes

## default

| Attribute                 | Description | Default Value |
| ---------                 | ----------- | ------------- |
| `stingray/path`           | The path where Stingray exists (or will be installed to) | `/opt/riverbed` |
| `stingray/version`        | The version of Stingray to install or configure | `90` |
| `stingray/arch`           | The binary architecture | `x86_64` |
| `stingray/tmpdir`         | The location used to store temporary files | `/tmp` |
| `stingray/accept_license` | Whether or not you accept the Riverbed [EULAs](http://www.riverbed.com/license).  Setting this to **accept** will indicate that you have read, understood and accepted the terms. | `reject` |
| `stingray/admin_user`     | The name of an administrative user. | `admin` |
| `stingray/admin_pass`     | The password to use/set for either joining or creating a cluster. |
| `stingray/java_enabled`   | Whether or not to enable support for Java™ Extentions. | `no` |
| `stingray/ec2`            | We need to do special things when launched into EC2, so use this if you are launching instances into EC2. | `no` |

stingray.title: Stingray options
stingray.description: Options for performing the installation and clustering operations.

stingray/pool.title: Pool attributes
stingray/pool.description: Options for creating, updating and deleting pools.

stingray/vserver.title: Virtual server option
stingray/vserver.description: Options for creating, updating and deleting virtual servers.

stingray/trafficipgroup.title: Traffic IP Group attributes
stingray/trafficipgroup.description: Attributes used to create, update or delete a Traffic IP Group.

recipes.stingray::trafficipgroup: Creates or updates a Traffic IP Group
recipes.stingray::reset_to_defaults: Removes the specified Stingray instance from it's current cluster (even if it's the only member).
recipes.stingray::cluster_new: Creates a new cluster with the specified installation.
recipes.stingray::cluster_join: Joins the specified Stingray installation to another.

name: stingray
